page.title: 07Education in Solihull.
page.content: In our area of Solihull children start school at the beginning of the year in which they are five and they attend primary school from then until they are eleven when they move on to a {secondary (Comprehensive)}school. They leave secondary school at sixteen but may continue their education at either the{Technical College}or the{Sixth {Form College. {Primary schools}in our area include Shirley Heath, Our Lady of the Wayside, St. Alphege, Widney Junior and Cranmore Infant. All these schools have their own school uniform. {Secondary schools}in the area include Alderbrook and Tudor Grange, which were both Grammar schools before the re-organisation in 1974, and St. Peters, which is a Roman Catholic school. All secondary school pupils wear a school uniform.
